gui

Class SimpleScreens

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.SimpleScreens

  • public class SimpleScreens
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements the screens that are displayed whenever the game is not in the playing state. The screens shown are the title screen, the generating screen with the progress bar during maze generation, and the final screen when the game finishes. The only one that is not simple and not covered by this class is the one that shows the first person view of the maze game and the map of the maze when the user really navigates inside the maze.
    Author:
    Peter Kemper

      • getFinishingRobotString

        private java.lang.String getFinishingRobotString()

      • redrawFinishWinning

        private void redrawFinishWinning(java.awt.Graphics gc)

        Prepare the ending screen in the case where the game is won-- i.e. the maze has been exited.

        There are two ways to arrive at this state: either a robot is enabled and exits the maze, or the player uses no robot and exits the maze. If a robot is present, certain robot metrics are displayed, obtained from getFinishingRobotString.

        Parameters:
        gc - the graphics panel on which to draw

      • redrawFinishLosing

        private void redrawFinishLosing(java.awt.Graphics gc)
        Prepare the ending screen in the case where the game is lost-- i.e. the robot has stopped before exiting. Alerts the user that the game has ended and provides a reason why the robot stopped.
        Parameters:
        gc - the graphics panel on which to draw

      • drawStateScreen_fromVarargs

        private void drawStateScreen_fromVarargs(java.awt.Graphics gc,
                                         java.awt.Color c,
                                         java.lang.Object[]... fontProp)
        Wraps around drawStateScreen_fromList.
        Parameters:
        gc - the graphics panel on which to draw
        c - Color object for background; does not accept null.
        fontProp - variable number of List arguments conforming to above specification

      • drawStateScreen_fromList

        private void drawStateScreen_fromList(java.awt.Graphics gc,
                                      java.awt.Color c,
                                      java.util.List<java.lang.Object[]> fontProp)

        Establishes a background color for the ending screen and then draws some number of messages on it. In addition to graphics panel argument, A List is passed whose members are lists; each of these inner lists has the following elements:

          (required) String the text that will be printed (required) int the vertical position of the text (optional) Color a Color to apply to the text (optional) Font a Font to apply to the text

        If the Color and Font elements are not supplied, they are inherited from the current graphics specifications. Supplying null is equivalent to not supplying. Note that the position of arguments determines type, so if one wants to specify a new font but not a new color, one must pass null for the Color element.

        Messages that do not fit on screen will have their font sizes automatically reduced.

        Parameters:
        gc - the graphics panel on which to draw
        c - Color object for background; does not accept null.
        fontProp - a List whose members are lists conforming to above specification

      • drawFinishScreenText

        private void drawFinishScreenText(java.awt.Graphics gc,
                                  java.lang.Object[] p)
        Draw a message on screen. Messages containing return characters (\n) are split into the appropriate number of lines. Messages wider than the screen are shrunk (but not split) to fit on screen.
        Parameters:
        gc - graphics panel on which to draw
        p - see drawStateScreen_fromVarargs for a description of what p contains

      • drawTextForceOnScreen

        private void drawTextForceOnScreen(java.awt.Graphics gc,
                                   java.lang.String message,
                                   int ypos)

        Bottommost method before centerString in chain of calls that draws a state screen.

        Functionality: if a message is too big to fit comfortably on the screen, decrement its font size until it fits on screen, then draw it by supplying it to centerString.

        Parameters:
        gc - graphics panel to draw on
        message - the message that will be drawn
        ypos - the vertical position of the text

      • redrawFinish

        private void redrawFinish(java.awt.Graphics gc)

        Helper method for redraw to draw final screen, screen is hard coded

        Updated in P3: this method redirects to redrawFinishWinning or redrawFinishWinning to draw outcome-dependent output to gc.

        Parameters:
        gc - the graphics that is the off-screen image

      • redrawGenerating

        Parameters:

      • redrawGenerating

        private void redrawGenerating(java.awt.Graphics gc)
        Helper method for redraw to draw screen during phase of maze generation. Screen is hard coded, only attribute percentdone is dynamic.
        Parameters:
        gc - graphics is the off screen image on which to draw
